messages.title: UKIP says YES to
messages.content: An NHS free at the point of delivery, No tax on the minimum wage, Housing priority for local people, Affordable energy

messages.title: UKIP says NO to
messages.content: Unlimited immigration, £55m a day membership fees to the EU, £12 billion a year in foreign aid, The 'bedroom tax' and the 'mansion tax'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: An NHS free at the point of delivery with £3 billion extra to the NHS to keep it free.
No tax on the minimum wage to maximise the take home wages of the poorest workers.
Housing priority for local people on existing sites not on green fields, to help local youngsters get on the ladder.
Invest in affordable energy from shale gas and nuclear not huge, over-subsidised wind and solar farms.
Stop unlimited immigration which leads to lower wages, pressure on health, housing and benefits, and fewer jobs for our children.
Oppose the £55 million a day membership fee to the EU.
Cut the £12 billion a year in foreign aid that is spent on countries with their own space programmes.
Oppose the 'bedroom tax' and 'mansion tax'. Simplify tax and welfare systems.

issues.health: An NHS free at the point of delivery with £3 billion extra to the NHS to keep it free.
issues.immigration: Stop unlimited immigration which leads to lower wages, pressure on health, housing and benefits, and fewer jobs for our children.
issues.socialWelfare: Oppose the 'bedroom tax' and 'mansion tax'. Simplify tax and welfare systems.

housing.content: Housing priority for local people on existing sites not on green fields, to help local youngsters get on the ladder.
